problem_text:
(H. Zassenhaus). Conjecture: Every invertible element of finite order of the integral group ring ZG of a finite group G is conjugate in the rational group ring QG to an element of ±G.
V. D. Mazurov
answer: A counterexample was constructed (F. Eisele, L. Margolis, Adv. Math. 339 (2018), 599–641).
